alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Grayson; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 18 at 5:01AM EST until December 19 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Ashe, Alleghany NC and Watauga Counties. In Virginia, Grayson, Carroll, Floyd and Roanoke Counties. * WHEN...High Wind Warning, through 7 PM EST this evening. Wind Advisory from 7PM this evening through 3PM Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds will occur today, then gradually diminish Tuesday.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. This can cause power outages...fallen trees... property damage...and dangerous driving conditions for high profile vehicles. Move unfastened items...such as garbage cans and deck furniture...indoors...including any holiday decorations. People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. Use caution if you must drive.
